page.title: 12Roborough Down (2).
page.content: Each farms acreage governs the number of stocking units awarded. One unit is five sheep,a pony or a cow. A Commons Registration Act comes into being in 1985 which will provide for more control over the amount of stock put onto commons. At each yearly 'drift' in, October, ponies are rounded up and claimed by the commoners prior to market in Tavistock. Ten years ago 700 ponies were involved, now it is only 200 to 300. During the drift mares are branded and put back on the common. The R.S.P.C.A. check livestock are kept in good condition and if farmers fail to cooperate may take them to court. Droughts and hard winters cause problems for the ponies which are no longer the true hardy Dartmoor Pony.
